items.name: Component_HotspotBehavior
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: Component_HotspotBehavior # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class HotspotShape @RECTANGLE = "rect" @PIXEL = "pixel" gs.HotspotShape = HotspotShape class Component_HotspotBehavior extends gs.Component ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> @setupEventHandlers() ###* * Adds a hotspot-behavior to a game object. That allows a game object * to respond to mouse/touch actions by firing an action-event or changing * the game object's image. * * @module gs * @class Component_HotspotBehavior * @extends gs.Component * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: (params) -> ###* * The shape used to detect if a hotspot is clicked, hovered, etc. * @property shape * @type boolean ### @shape = gs.HotspotShape.RECTANGLE ###* * Indicates if the hotspot is selected. * @property selected * @type boolean ### @selected = no ###* * Indicates if the hotspot is enabled. * @property enabled * @type boolean ### @enabled = yes ###* * @property imageHandling * @type number * @protected ### @imageHandling = 0 ###* * Indicates if the mouse/touch pointer is inside the hotspot bounds. * @property contains * @type boolean * @protected ### @containsPointer = no ###* * Indicates if the action-button was pressed before. * @property buttonUp * @type boolean * @protected ### @buttonUp = no ###* * Indicates if the action-button is pressed. * @property buttonDown * @type boolean * @protected ### @buttonDown = no ###* * @property actionButtons * @type Object * @protected ### @actionButtons = { "left": Input.Mouse.BUTTON_LEFT, "right": Input.Mouse.BUTTON_RIGHT, "middle": Input.Mouse.BUTTON_MIDDLE } ###* * The default action-button. By default the left-button is used. * * @property actionButton * @type number ### @actionButton = @actionButtons[params?.actionButton ? "left"] ###* * The sound played if the hotspot action is executed. * @property sound * @type Object ### @sound = params?.sound ###* *

The sounds played depending on the hotspot state.

*
    *
  • 0 = Select Sound
    • *
  • 1 = Unselect Sound
    • *
* @property sounds * @type Object[] ### @sounds = params?.sounds || [] ###* * Sets up event handlers. * * @method setupEventHandlers ### setupEventHandlers: -> gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseUp", ((e) => return if not @object.visible mx = Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x my = Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height, mx, my) if contains contains = @checkShape(mx - @object.dstRect.x, my - @object.dstRect.y) if contains @containsPointer = contains @updateInput() @updateEvents() @object.needsUpdate = yes e.breakChain = yes ), null, @object if @object.images or yes gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseMoved", ((e) => return if not @object.visible contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height, Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) if contains mx = Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x my = Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y contains = @checkShape(mx - @object.dstRect.x, my - @object.dstRect.y) if @containsPointer != contains @containsPointer = contains @object.needsUpdate = yes if contains @object.events.emit("enter", this) else @object.events.emit("leave", this) @updateInput() ), null, @object ###* * Initializes the hotspot component. * * @method setup ### setup: -> super @sound = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(@object, @sound) if @sounds? for sound, i in @sounds @sounds[i] = ui.Component_FormulaHandler.fieldValue(@object, sound) else @sounds = [] @setupEventHandlers() ###* * Disposes the component. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> super gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseUp", @object) gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseMoved", @object) ###* * Checks if the specified point is inside of the hotspot's shape. * * @method checkShape * @param x - The x-coordinate of the point. * @param y - The y-coordinate of the point. * @return If true the point is inside of the hotspot's shape. Otherwise false. ### checkShape: (x, y) -> result = yes switch @shape when gs.HotspotShape.PIXEL if @object.bitmap result = @object.bitmap.isPixelSet(x, y) else result = @object.target?.bitmap.isPixelSet(x, y) return result ###* * Updates the image depending on the hotspot state. * * @method updateImage * @protected ### updateImage: -> object = @object.target || @object if @object.images? baseImage = if @enabled then @object.images[4] || @object.images[0] else @object.images[0] if @containsPointer if @object.selected or @selected object.image = @object.images[3] || @object.images[2] || baseImage else object.image = @object.images[1] || baseImage else if @object.selected or @selected object.image = @object.images[2] || @object.images[4] || baseImage else object.image = baseImage if !object.image object.bitmap = null ###* * Updates the hotspot position and size from an other target game object. For example, * that is useful for adding a hotspot to an other moving game object. * * @method updateFromTarget * @protected ### updateFromTarget: -> if @object.target? @object.dstRect.x = @object.target.dstRect.x @object.dstRect.y = @object.target.dstRect.y @object.dstRect.width = @object.target.dstRect.width @object.dstRect.height = @object.target.dstRect.height @object.offset.x = @object.target.offset.x @object.offset.y = @object.target.offset.y @object.origin.x = @object.target.origin.x @object.origin.y = @object.target.origin.y ###* * Updates the event-handling and fires necessary events. * * @method updateEvents * @protected ### updateEvents: -> if @buttonUp and @object.enabled and @enabled and @object.visible if @object.selectable group = gs.ObjectManager.current.objectsByGroup(@object.group) for object in group if object != @object object.selected = no if @object.group @selected = yes else @selected = !@selected if @selected AudioManager.playSound(@sounds[0] || @sound) else AudioManager.playSound(@sounds[1] || @sound) @object.events.emit("click", this) @object.events.emit("stateChanged", @object) else AudioManager.playSound(@sounds[0] || @sound) @object.events.emit("click", this) @object.events.emit("action", this) ###* * Updates the game object's color depending on the state of the hotspot. * * @method updateColor * @protected ### updateColor: -> if !@object.enabled @object.color.set(0, 0, 0, 100) else @object.color.set(0, 0, 0, 0) ###* * Stores current states of mouse/touch pointer and buttons. * * @method updateInput * @protected ### updateInput: -> @buttonUp = Input.Mouse.buttons[@actionButton] == 2 and @containsPointer @buttonDown = Input.Mouse.buttons[@actionButton] == 1 and @containsPointer ###* * Updates the hotspot component. * * @method update ### update: -> if not @object.visible then return @updateColor() @updateFromTarget() @updateImage() gs.Component_HotspotBehavior = Component_HotspotBehavior
